body.p: Transaction costs incurred in acquiring an asset or incurring a liability are a feature of the transaction in which the asset was acquired or the liability was incurred. Hence:Â

li.p: the historical cost and current cost of an asset or liability reflect those transaction costs. Although the transaction costs are not part of the transaction price, the entity could not have acquired the asset or incurred the liability without incurring those transaction costs.

if the measure is intended to depict the fair value, fulfilment value or value in use of an asset or liability, the measure does not reflect those transaction costs. Those costs do not affect the current value of that asset or liability.
